recipe_name: Panzanella with sautéed potatoes and chickpeas
author: Paul Rankin
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. For the panzanella, heat the oil in a pan and fry the bread pieces for 2-3 minutes until golden-brown. Season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper, then add the potatoes, chickpeas and mushrooms together, stirring well to combine. Transfer to the oven to cook for another 4-5 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. For the dressing, whisk the passata and olive oil together and drizzle over the panzanella. Toss to coat evenly, then serve.
ingredients: 3 tbsp olive oil,  3 slices stale good quality white bread, torn into pieces,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  100g/3½oz new potatoes, cooked and thickly sliced,  2 tbsp tinned chickpeas, rinsed and drained,  3 small mushrooms, quartered,  200ml/7fl oz tomato passata,  2 tbsp olive oil
